current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To establish a temporary limitation on the use of funds to transfer or release individuals detained
			 at United States Naval Station, Guantanamo Bay, Cuba.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Guantanamo Bay Detainee Transfer Suspension Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Guantanamo Bay Detainee Transfer Suspension Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Temporary limitation on use of funds to transfer or release individuals detained at United States
			 Naval Station, Guantanamo Bay, Cuba

			 release

			 foreign entity until the earlier of—

text.#text:
An officer or employee of the United States  shall be liable in his or her individual capacity for
			 a civil penalty of $10,000 for each covered detainee at Guantanamo
			 transferred or released in violation of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Guantanamo Bay Detainee Transfer Suspension Act of 2014/s:2/ss:c/p:1

text.#text: A person may bring a civil action for a violation of

A copy of the complaint and written disclosure of substantially all material evidence and
			 information the person possesses shall be served on the Government
			 pursuant to rule 4 of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure. The Government
			 may elect to intervene and proceed with the action within 30 days after it
			 receives both the complaint and the material evidence and information.
proceed with the action, in which case the action shall be conducted by the Government; or

notify the court that it declines to take over the action, in which case the person bringing the
			 action shall have the right to conduct the action.

text.#text: Before the expiration of the 30-day period under

If the Government elects not to proceed with the action, and upon request and at the Government's
			 expense, the Government  shall be served with copies of all pleadings
			 filed in the action and shall be supplied with copies of all deposition
			 transcripts.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall receive 50 percent of the amount of the
			 civil penalty imposed on the officer or employee of the United States and
			 the court shall award the person reasonable expenses which the court finds
			 to have been necessarily incurred, plus reasonable attorneys' fees and
			 costs, to be paid by the defendant.

text.#text: Not later than 60 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

A detailed description of the previous assessments by Joint Task Force Guantanamo regarding the
			 risk that
			 the 5 detainees transferred from United States Naval Station,
			 Guantanamo Bay Cuba, to Qatar on May 31, 2014, would reengage in terrorist
			 activity after transfer.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and the
